00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantRma.cpp
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Mon Oct 24 10:35:48 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Class for doing probe set quantification using median polish
00028  * as does RMA.
00029  */

00044 using namespace std;
00045 /** 
00046  * @brief Clear out all the data.
00047  */
00048 void QuantRma::clear() {
00049   unsigned int probeIx = 0, chipIx = 0;
00050  
00051   // Set the world to 0
00052   for(chipIx = 0; chipIx < m_PM.size(); chipIx++) {
00053     for(probeIx = 0; probeIx < m_PM[0].size(); probeIx++) {
00054       m_PM[chipIx][probeIx] = 0;
00055       m_MM[chipIx][probeIx] = 0;
00056     }
00057   }
00058   for(chipIx = 0; chipIx < m_ChipEffects.size(); chipIx++) 
00059     m_ChipEffects[chipIx] = 0;
00060   
00061   for(probeIx = 0; probeIx < m_ProbeEffects.size(); probeIx++)
00062     m_ProbeEffects[probeIx] = 0;
00063 }
00064 
00065 /** 
00066  * Set the number of probes and number of chips to be used for estimation.
00067  * @param numProbes - Probe count.
00068  * @param numChips - Microarray count.
00069  */
00070 void QuantRma::setBounds(unsigned int numProbes, unsigned int numChips) {
00071   unsigned int i = 0;
00072   m_ProbeCount = numProbes;
00073   m_ChipCount = numChips;
00074   /* Check empty case. */
00075   if(m_PM.empty()) {
00076     m_ChipEffects.resize(numChips);
00077     m_ProbeEffects.resize(numProbes);
00078     while(m_PM.size() < numChips) {
00079       m_PM.push_back(vector<float>(numProbes));
00080       m_MM.push_back(vector<float>(numProbes));
00081     }
00082   }
00083   /* Check number of columns (probes). */
00084   if(numProbes > m_PM[0].size()) {
00085     m_ProbeEffects.resize(numProbes);
00086     for(i = 0; i < m_PM.size(); i++) {
00087       m_PM[i].resize(numProbes);
00088       m_MM[i].resize(numProbes);
00089     }
00090   }
00091   /* Check number of rows (chips). */
00092   if(numChips > m_PM.size()) {
00093     m_ChipEffects.resize(numChips);
00094     while(m_PM.size() < numChips) {
00095       m_PM.push_back(vector<float>(m_PM[0].size()));
00096       m_MM.push_back(vector<float>(m_MM[0].size()));
00097     }
00098   }
00099 }
00100 
00101 /** 
00102  * @brief Do the heavy lifting of median polish. If PM-MM is zero
00103  * threshold at a small positive number to avoid taking logs of
00104  * numbers that aren't positive.
00105  */
00106 void QuantRma::computeEstimate() {
00107   float intensity = 0;
00108   unsigned int colIx = 0, rowIx = 0;
00109   
00110   for(rowIx = 0; rowIx < m_ChipCount; rowIx++) {
00111     for(colIx = 0; colIx < m_ProbeCount; colIx++) {
00112       if(m_Attenuate) {
00113         intensity = attenuateIntensity(m_PM[rowIx][colIx],m_MM[rowIx][colIx],m_L,m_H);
00114       }
00115       else {
00116         intensity = m_PM[rowIx][colIx] - m_MM[rowIx][colIx];
00117       }
00118       /* Don't want negative values, threshold at RMA_MIN_VALUE */
00119       m_PM[rowIx][colIx] = max(intensity, (float)RMA_MIN_VALUE);
00120     }
00121   }
00122 
00123   if(m_FitFeatureResponse){
00124     if(m_UseInputModel){
00125           if (m_FixFeatureEffect) {
00126             std::vector<std::vector<float> > PM = m_PM;
00127         RMA::medianPolishWithPrecomputedEffectsUsedAsSeedValues(m_PM, m_ChipCount, m_ProbeCount, m_ProbeEffects, m_ChipEffects);
00128         RMA::medianPolishWithPrecomputedEffectsOnePass(PM, m_ChipCount, m_ProbeCount, m_ProbeEffects, m_ChipEffects);
00129           } else {
00130         RMA::medianPolishWithPrecomputedEffectsUsedAsSeedValues(m_PM, m_ChipCount, m_ProbeCount, m_ProbeEffects, m_ChipEffects);
00131           }
00132     }else{
00133           if (m_FixFeatureEffect) {
00134             std::vector<std::vector<float> > PM = m_PM;
00135         RMA::medianPolishPsetFromMatrix(m_PM, m_ChipCount, m_ProbeCount, m_ProbeEffects, m_ChipEffects);
00136         RMA::medianPolishWithPrecomputedEffectsOnePass(PM, m_ChipCount, m_ProbeCount, m_ProbeEffects, m_ChipEffects);
00137           } else {
00138         RMA::medianPolishPsetFromMatrix(m_PM, m_ChipCount, m_ProbeCount, m_ProbeEffects, m_ChipEffects);
00139           }
00140     }
00141   } else{
00142     if(m_UseInputModel){
00143       RMA::medianPolishWithPrecomputedEffectsOnePass(m_PM, m_ChipCount, m_ProbeCount, m_ProbeEffects, m_ChipEffects);
00144     } else{
00145       Err::errAbort("Invalid combination of Fit Feature Response and Use Input Model, both cannot be false.");
00146     }
00147   }
00148 
00149 }
00150 
00151 
00152 /** 
00153  * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00154  * set, chip layout and data.
00155  * 
00156  * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00157  * @param layout - Chip layout annotation.
00158  * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00159  * @param iTrans - Transformations to be applied to data before use.
00160  * @param pmAdjust - How to estimate background, or MM probe.
00161  * @return bool - True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00162  */
00163 bool QuantRma::setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00164                      std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00165   unsigned int chipIx = 0, probeIx = 0, psIx, atomIx = 0;
00166   unsigned int chipCount = 0, atomPmCount = 0;
00167   float intensity = 0.0;
00168   assert(psGroup.probeSets.size() > 0);
00169   chipCount = iMart.getCelFileCount();
00170   int numberOfProbes = psGroup.countPmProbes();
00171   if(numberOfProbes == 0)
00172     return false;
00173   /* Prepare the quantification method for this many atoms and chips. */
00174   setBounds(numberOfProbes, chipCount);
00175   
00176   atomPmCount = 0;
00177   m_Probes.clear();
00178   /* Loop through and fill in the data as coming from the intensity mart. */
00179   for(psIx = 0; psIx < psGroup.probeSets.size(); psIx++) {
00180     const ProbeSet *ps = psGroup.probeSets[psIx];
00181     if(ps == NULL)
00182       continue;
00183     for(atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps->atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
00184       Atom &atom = *(ps->atoms[atomIx]);
00185       unsigned int channelIx = atom.getChannelCode();
00186       for(probeIx = 0; probeIx < atom.probes.size(); probeIx++) {
00187         Probe *p = atom.probes[probeIx];
00188         if(p->type == Probe::PMST || p->type == Probe::PMAT) {
00189           unsigned int probeIndex = p->id;
00190           /* If we are using precomputed probe effects fill in each probe here. */
00191           if(m_UsePrecompEffects) {    
00192             m_ProbeEffects.resize(numberOfProbes);
00193             if (m_FeaturePriorEffect == NULL) {
00194                         Verbose::out(1, "trying to use feature effects but null.");
00195               Err::errAbort("No feature effects available.");
00196             }
00197             else {
00198               /// Expected feature effect is 1.0 +/- some minor adjustment.
00199               try {
00200                 m_ProbeEffects[atomPmCount] = m_FeaturePriorEffect[p->getApid()];
00201               } 
00202               catch(...) {
00203                           Verbose::out(1, "Feature effect for probe "+ ToStr(p->id + 1) +" is out of bounds.");
00204                 Err::errAbort("Feature effect for probe "+ ToStr(p->id + 1) +" is out of bounds.");
00205               }
00206 
00207               if (m_ProbeEffects[atomPmCount] <= 0) {
00208                 Err::errAbort("The feature effect values must be positive.  Feature effect for probe "+ ToStr(p->id + 1) +" = "+ ToStr(m_ProbeEffects[atomPmCount]));
00209               } // Safety against log zero.
00210             }
00211           }
00212 
00213           m_Probes.push_back(p);
00214           for(chipIx = 0; chipIx < chipCount; chipIx++) {
00215             /* PM transformation. */
00216             intensity = transformPrimaryData(probeIndex, chipIx, iMart, iTrans, channelIx);
00217             /* MM transformation. */
00218             float mmIntensity = 0;
00219 
00220             pmAdjust.pmAdjustment(p->id, chipIx, iMart, iTrans, intensity, mmIntensity);
00221             setPMDataAt(atomPmCount, chipIx, intensity);
00222             setMMDataAt(atomPmCount, chipIx, mmIntensity);
00223           }
00224           atomPmCount++;
00225         }
00226       }
00227     } /* atoms. */
00228   } /* probe sets. */
00229   return true;
00230 }
00231 
00232 /**
00233  * Custom configuration for this QuantMethod
00234  */
00235 void QuantRma::setParameters(PsBoard &board) {
00236   string featEff = board.getOptions()->getOpt("use-feat-eff");
00237     if (!featEff.empty()) {
00238       ChipLayout *layout = NULL;
00239       board.get("chiplayout", &layout);
00240       int size = layout->m_PlFactory.getApidMax();
00241       double *effects = new double[size];
00242       fill(effects, effects+size, 0);
00243       int probeCount = QuantMethodFactory::openPrecompFeatureEffects(featEff, effects, *layout);
00244       Verbose::out(1, "Loaded " + ToStr(probeCount) + " feature effects.");
00245       setFeaturePriorEffects(effects, size);
00246       FreezArray(effects);
00247     }
00248   }
